samples.question: What kind of food do you like?
samples.transcript: Honestly, I always have a soft spot for pizza with a lot of cheese on top.
samples.transcript_original: Honestly, I always have a soft spot for pizza with a lot of cheese on top.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Honestly, I always have a soft spot for pizza with a lot of cheese on top.

samples.question: However, I think that it might not be all that healthy to eat so much cheese.
samples.transcript: As I have heard, it can lead to high levels of bad cholesterol, which increase the risk of heart disease. Né tránh. Chiến thuật này mình có thể dùng lúc mình chưa thực sự nghĩ ra được câu trả lời và muốn câu giờ một tí để nghĩ thêm ideas. Thì mình sẽ dạo đầu bằng một câu vu vơ trước. Tất nhiên là vẫn liên quan đến câu hỏi, nhưng mình chưa đưa ra câu trả lời gì cả.

samples.question: Ví dụ như được hỏi là bạn thích đọc sách hay là xem TV?
samples.transcript: So I will be like, I like playing in the air, so I cannot read books or read books. After a few seconds to think, I will give a answer. But if I am forced to choose something, I think I like to watch TV more.

samples.question: What are the popular kinds of shops in your country Well, there are a wide range of places to go shopping.
samples.transcript: One of the most popular types is department stores. I think this is because they often stock high quality products and offer a clear 30-day refund policy if customers are not happy with their purchase. Another trendy place that people in my country enjoy shopping at is local markets. I guess people are motivated by the fact that these places sell stuff at a cheaper price compared to that of big supermarkets, though the quality is not always guaranteed. On a general level, small local shops and traditional markets are common across the country, as they provide unique products and experiences for shoppers. More specifically, these places are not just places to buy goods, but they are social hubs where people connect with each other. For example, at traditional markets in Vietnam, you can find everything from fresh produce and seafood to textiles and souvenirs. it is a lively environment where haggling is part of the experience, and these markets play an essential role in Vietnamese culture and daily life. The popularity of different types of shops in Vietnam varies based on the region. In big cities like Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City, large shopping malls and modern retail stores are becoming increasingly popular, especially among younger generations who are looking for branded goods, fashion items, and entertainment options. On the other hand, in smaller towns and rural areas, traditional markets and small, family-owned shops are also becoming more popular. The shops are still the go-to places for most people. These markets offer fresh, locally sourced products, and there is a personal touch to the shopping experience, where relationships between sellers and buyers are often built over time. supermarkets and chain stores have grown rapidly in Vietnam, especially in urban areas, because they offer a wide range of products in one place, making them very convenient for people with busy schedules.

samples.question: However, despite this growth, many local residents still prefer shopping at traditional markets.
samples.transcript: These markets are valued for offering fresher produce often at lower prices, and the experience feels more personal. Plus, the markets are part of the local culture and history. While supermarkets are convenient, they can sometimes feel impersonal and more expensive compared to these traditional settings. it is hard to pinpoint just one type of shop that is popular in my country. Because people's preferences can vary greatly. Some might argue that modern shopping centers are the most popular because they offer one-stop solutions for everything, from groceries to electronics. But in my opinion, traditional street vendors and convenience stores are still more popular overall, especially in urban areas. The reason is that these options are affordable, easily accessible, and catered to the daily needs of the majority. You can grab a quick snack, buy some vegetables, or even pick up a house or supplies without having to travel far. Rằng tiếp theo là comparing. Nó sẽ bắt mình so sánh hai từ gì đó.

samples.question: Do men and women like to talk about the same topics?
samples.transcript: I think men and women often talk about different topics based on their interests. On one hand, men might focus more on things like sports or technology because these are the areas they are passionate about or heavily involved in. On the other hand, women tend to lean towards topics like relationships or personal experiences, which they find meaningful and engaging. Of course, these are just general trends and everyone's different. in general, men and women do talk about some of the same things, especially when it comes to shared experiences like family, work, or social events. But when you dig a little deeper, the differences become clearer. Guys might get really into discussing the details of recent games or new tech gadgets, while women often focus more on personal stories, relationships, or social topics. For example, at a casual gathering, you might notice guys clustered around the TV talking about the latest match, while the women are more likely to be exchanging updates on their lives or discussing the latest trends. So whilst there is definitely overlap, each group tends to have its own go-to topics. I think it really depends on who is talking and the situation. In mixed groups, people usually stick to more neutral topics like movies, travel, or general news that everyone can join in on. But when it is all men or all women, the conversations often shift towards their specific interests. Guys might focus on sports, hobbies, or tech, while women lean more towards relationships, social matters, or lifestyle topics. So the dynamics really changes depending on the group makeup and the context, but overall, it is about what is relevant and interesting to the people involved. Clearly, I think men and women often have different preferences when it comes to topics. In general, men are more likely to discuss sports or current global events, while women often enjoy conversations about shopping or the latest fashion trends.

samples.question: Is it good or bad for people to have free education in the future?
samples.transcript: Having free education in the future could be highly advantageous for society. Initially, it would ensure that everyone has equal access to educational opportunities, regardless of their economic status. This could lead to a more educated and skilled workforce, benefiting the economy as a whole. Moreover, free education could significantly reduce student debt, allowing graduates to start their careers without financial burdens. Both of these factors could contribute to a more equitable and prosperous society. I believe that in general, free education could be a positive development for society. It would ensure that everyone has the chance to learn and grow without a financial burden for citizens. More specifically, this could lead to a more educated workforce and potentially lower unemployment rates. For instance, if everyone could afford to go to college or vocational training, it might boost economic growth and innovation.

samples.question: However, it is important to consider how to manage the costs and resources to make it effective.
samples.transcript: I think whether the possible consequence of free education is good or bad really depends on the implementation. In countries with strong financial systems and resources, free education could be a fantastic way to promote equality and economic development. But in countries where resources are limited, it could be challenging to maintain quality and access. For example, while free education might work well in a country with a robust economy that can support the costs, it could strain the system in a developing nation if not carefully planned. Offering free education in the future could be advantages, because it would make learning accessible to everyone and help reduce inequality.

samples.question: However, there are concerns that it could lead to higher taxes or government spending, which might be challenging to manage.
samples.transcript: So while the idea of free education is appealing and could bring many benefits, it is crucial to balance it with considerations about funding and quality. The topic of free education often sparks a lot of debate. Some might argue that it could bring a lot of advantages, since it would open doors for many people who otherwise could not afford it. But on the other hand, there are concerns about how to fund it and ensure that educational standards are maintained. Personally, I think that the idea has a lot of potential benefits, but would need careful planning to address the financial and logistical challenges involved.

samples.question: What are the advantages of distance learning?
samples.transcript: Distance learning has some clear advantages. For starters, it offers incredible flexibility, allowing students to learn at their own pace and fit their studies around their busy lives, which is a real game changer. Additionally, it makes education more accessible to those in remote or underserved areas who might otherwise be left out in the cold. This means more people can have the opportunities to advance their skills regardless of their geographical constraints. All in all, it can be a win-win situation for expanding educational access. Overall, distance learning can be a fantastic option for many. It provides the freedom to study when and where it suits you, which is a big plus for anyone with a tight schedule. More specifically, this flexibility allows someone working full-time to hit the virtual books in the evenings or on the weekends. For example, if you are balancing a job and family, online courses can be a real life-saver, fitting seamlessly into your life. This adaptability can make continuing education much more manageable and less stressful. The benefits of distance learning really depend on individual needs. For someone with a hectic schedule or who lives far from educational institutions, it is a lifesaver, offering the chance to study without needing to commute.

samples.question: How can we encourage people to do more exercise?
samples.transcript: Encouraging people to exercise more can be approached in a couple of ways. For starters, making exercise fun and social can be a real motivator, like organizing group activities or fitness challenges, which makes working out feel less like a chore. Additionally, providing incentives or rewards for reaching fitness goals can give people that extra push they need. By combining enjoyment with tangible rewards, people might be more inclined to get off their couch and get moving. To encourage more exercise, we can start by promoting the benefits of staying active in groups. This way, members can follow one another to achieve a better well-being. More specifically, setting up community fitness programs or local sports leagues can make getting active more accessible and appealing. For instance, having a weekend soccer league or free yoga classes in the park can help people incorporate exercise into their routines more easily and regularly. This not only enhances their health but also broadens people's social circles. Encouraging exercise often depends on the individual and their circumstances. For socially engaged individuals, joining a gym or fitness class might be a great way to stay motivated. But for those with a sedentary lifestyle, finding ways to exercise at home like following online workouts videos or using fitness apps might be more effective if they prefer privacy. So it is important to tailor the approach based on what fits best with each person's lifestyle and preferences. Promoting more exercise can be achieved through engaging methods like fun group workouts or community sports events. These can be effective in getting people active.

By combining enjoyment with tangible rewards, people might be more inclined to get off their couch and get moving. To encourage more exercise, we can start by promoting the benefits of staying active in groups. This way, members can follow one another to achieve a better well-being. More specifically, setting up community fitness programs or local sports leagues can make getting active more accessible and appealing. For instance, having a weekend soccer league or free yoga classes in the park can help people incorporate exercise into their routines more easily and regularly. This not only enhances their health but also broadens people's social circles. Encouraging exercise often depends on the individual and their circumstances. For socially engaged individuals, joining a gym or fitness class might be a great way to stay motivated. But for those with a sedentary lifestyle, finding ways to exercise at home like following online workouts videos or using fitness apps might be more effective if they prefer privacy. So it's important to tailor the approach based on what fits best with each person's lifestyle and preferences. Promoting more exercise can be achieved through engaging methods like fun group workouts or community sports events. These can be effective in getting people active.

samples.question: Why do so many people move from the countryside to cities?
samples.transcript: There are a couple of key reasons why people often move from this countryside to the cities. For one, cities offer more educational options and job opportunities, which can be a major draw from people to pursue their academic or professional endeavors. Additionally, urban areas tend to have better access to amenities and services, such as healthcare and entertainment, which can make city living more appealing. Both of these factors can make the city a more attractive option for those seeking a change. Generally, people move from the countryside to cities for better jobs prospects and more vibrant lifestyles. On a more specific level, cities offer a wide range of employment opportunities that might not be available in rural areas. In rural areas. For example, someone might relocate to the city to pursue a career in tech or finance fields that are more concentrated in urban environments. This shift often brings greater convenience and access to services as well. The reasons for moving from the countryside to cities can vary depending on individual needs and goals. For some, the move is driven by the change for professional growth, and urban areas often provide more job opportunities. For others, it might be about assessing better healthcare, education, or social activities. So whether it is about climbing the career ladder or enjoying urban amenities, it really depends on what people are looking to achieve with their move. Many people move from the countryside to cities for better job prospects and assess to amenities. Cities generally provide more career opportunities and a wider range of services, which can be very appealing.
